coinSection.__coin_title_current_player_red: Today you have a red card
coinSection.__done_work_for_today: You have completed your work for today. The next day will start when everyone is finished
coinSection.__red_rules_choice: Choose one of the following actions:
coinSection.__red_first_rule: one of your unblocked cards one column right
coinSection.__red_third_rule: move a card from the Â«QueueÂ» one column to the right into the Â«DoingÂ» column so it becomes Work In Progress
coinSection.__red_last_rule: And only if you can't move own cards - Help someone! Advance or unblock another playerâ€™s card
coinSection.__black_first_rule: to one of your currently unblocked items
coinSection.__black_second_rule: move a card from the Â«QueueÂ» one column to the right into the Â«DoingÂ» column so it becomes Work In Progress. And only if you can't start new item - help someone! Advance or unblock another player's card.
coinSection.__no_moves_rule: You don't have available movements. Please, wait other players to finish their movements.
coinSection.__black_last_rule: Help someone! Advance or unblock another playerâ€™s item
coinSection.__black_start_or_help_rule: Start a new item: push it to the Â«In progressÂ» column. And only if you can't start new item - help someone! Advance or unblock another player's item.
coinSection.__firstly_black_first_rule: FIRSTLY block one of your currently unblocked items
coinSection.__secondly_black_start_or_help_rule: SECONDLY start a new item: push it to the Â«In progressÂ» column. And only if you can't start new item - help someone! Advance or unblock another player's item.

gameExplanation.__in_game_rules: All rules will be available during the game by clicking Â«GAME RULESÂ» button
gameExplanation.__about_game: It is a simple, fun and highly customizable kanban simulation game. Since its creation in 2014 it has been used by trainers and coaches in Lean, Agile and Kanban-related events the world over.
gameExplanation.__workflow_description: Game is split into several iterations. First iteration is just about visual management. Each card on the board represents a task, that has to be done by your team. All new tasks appear in the first Â«QueueÂ» column. To finish it you have to pull the card to Â«DoneÂ» column. The card goes through the number of the stages in the middle. There are two in progress stages - Â«In ProgressÂ» and Â«TestingÂ».
gameExplanation.__card_owners: When you move the card to Â«In ProgressÂ» column you become responsible for it and your avatar appears on that card.
gameExplanation.__game_begin: Game begins with one item assigned per player
gameExplanation.__coin_info: In the beginning of each day every player will get a random card (black/red). Why is it necessary? People start a piece of work and think it is going to take one day. But sometimes it takes much more - 2 days, 3 days and even more. There is always a chance of variation and there are lots of reasons for that. Each playing card gives you certain moves.
gameExplanation.__coin_certain_moves: Each card gives you certain moves.
gameExplanation.__red_unblock: OR unblock one of your items
gameExplanation.__red_help: And if you have no other option, help someone else â€“ advance or unblock one of theirs
gameExplanation.__black_help: If you can't start a new item, help someone else instead - advance or unblock one of theirs
gameExplanation.__block_card: Block one of your items (only if you have one to block)
gameExplanation.__block_info: Bad things happen in game just like in real life. And sometimes your work will get blocked. Block means you can't progress work for some reason. It might be dependant on some other task that is not currently ready. After card is blocked, you can't move it to the right.
gameExplanation.__black_first_rule: BOTH block one of your currently unblocked items if you have one to block
gameExplanation.__black_second_rule: AND start a new item if any remain, move it to the first in-progress column (even if you had nothing to block)
gameExplanation.__black_help_rule: If and only if you canâ€™t start a new item, help someone! Advance or unblock another playerâ€™s item
gameExplanation.__red_help_rule: If and only if you canâ€™t make one of these moves for yourself, help someone! Advance or unblock another playerâ€™s item
gameExplanation.__begin_game_text: Main goal is to pull as much cards to the Â«DoneÂ» column as you can! All other things you will discover through playing the game. Push the Â«ReadyÂ» button, and let's play Featureban!
gameExplanation.__second_iteration_rules: Rules are exactly the same as they were before with only one difference. WIP (Work In Progress) limits are added to in progress stages - for columns Â«In ProgressÂ» and Â«TestingÂ».
gameExplanation.__second_iteration_days_count: Amount of days spent in work is now added to each card
gameExplanation.__second_iteration_help: Please remember, if you can't push your own item - HELP somebody else!
gameExplanation.__third_iteration_rules: Rules are exactly the same as they were before.
gameExplanation.__third_iteration_description: Try to deliver all of your items to Â«DoneÂ» column as soon as possible. Collaborate! This is the key to final result.
gameExplanation.__third_iteration_metrics: We added histograms to help you track your progress.
gameExplanation.__third_iteration_new_state: All cards from previous iterations are removed, new cards in column Â«QueueÂ» are added. This way it will be much easier to compare results and metrics from previous iterations with current iteration.
gameExplanation.__metrics_info: Columns and cards metrics have been added
gameExplanation.__metrics_column_count: Shows how many cards were each day in each column by the end of the day
gameExplanation.__metrics_lead_time: Shows the day when card was pushed in the in-progress column. The day when card was pushed to Â«DoneÂ» column. And the total amount of days card was in progress.
gameExplanation.__metrics_description: Take a closer look at metrics.
gameExplanation.__cfd_description: The chart tracks the total number of work items. The horizontal axis of the CFD represents the time frame for which the chart is visualizing data. The vertical axis shows the cumulative number of cards that are in the workflow at the various points in time. The differently colored bands that divide sections of the upward flow are the different stages of your workflow. Using a CFD, you can get an idea of how long is the approximate cycle time of your tasks in just a single glance.
gameExplanation.__lead_time_description: The lead time chart allows you to view the average number of days it takes work to flow through your process.
gameExplanation.__kick_player_info: In case one of players went offline, you can remove such player by changing his game role to spectator. He will be still in game by just watching it. In case that player owns some tasks placed in progress columns, you have to choose other person, who will get responsible for those tasks.
gameExplanation.__communication_desc: To try it, just participate as a player or spectator and share the link. Youâ€™ll need to be in close online communication while you play (we donâ€™t provide that part).
gameExplanation.__several_games_update_desc: You no longer need to run featureban from different browsers: now you can participate in several games in one browser.

rulesDialog.__about_game: Each card on the board represents a task, that has to be done by your team. All new tasks will appear in first Â«QueueÂ» column. To finish it you have to pull the card till Â«DoneÂ» column by pressing arrow button on the card. There are two in progress stages - Â«In ProgressÂ» and Â«TestingÂ». When you push a card to the Â«In ProgressÂ» column you become responsible for it and your avatar will be added to that card. When all tasks will leave first column - new one will be generated.
rulesDialog.__coin_rules: In the beginning of each turn there will be random (black/red) card chosen. Each card gives you certain moves.
rulesDialog.__wip_rules: There are numbers near in progress columns titles - they represent WIP (Work In Progress) limits. You can't move cards into columns that are at or above capacity.
rulesDialog.__main_goal: Main goal of the game is to pull as much cards in done column as you can.
rulesDialog.__block_info: Block means you can't progress work for some reason. After card is blocked, you can't push it to the right.

__preIterationQuestionsTitle: Please answer a few questions. All of them are optional.
secondPreIterationQuestions: What elements seem familiar from your working experience? New?
Suppose we continue in this way indefinitely. Then what happens?
thirdPreIterationQuestions: How was it different? Please name drawbacks and benefits.
Could you guess any variations on this theme? Are there any other ways to limit work in progress?
Name parallels from your working experience.

gameLog.__no_data_key_stats: At least one completed card during iteration is required to show key stats

notifications.__can_not_start_card: You can't start a new card now 😩

notifications.__should_move_your_card: You have your own card that you can push 😌
notifications.__role_changed: You was removed from game by admin. But you can still watch it as spectator.
notifications.__responsible_for_remove_user_cards: Â«{{userName}}Â» is now spectator. Admin has chosen you as responsible for all Â«{{userName}}Â» in progress cards
notifications.__already_updated_card: Unfortunately, another player already updated the card
notifications.__day_changed: Day {{day}} is over: all players have made their movements. Start planning the next day
notifications.__user_move_done: You have completed all the moves for today ðŸ’ª

black.__should_block_card: tried to move the card #{{cardNumber}} to the Â«{{destinationColumn}}Â» before adding blocker to one of the own card
black.__should_start_card: tried to move the card #{{cardNumber}} to the Â«{{destinationColumn}}Â» before stating a new card

red.__should_move_own_card: tried to move not own card #{{cardNumber}}

common.__move_blocked_card: tried to move the blocked card #{{cardNumber}}
common.__move_done_card: tried to move the done card #{{cardNumber}}
common.__user_move_done: tried to move the card #{{cardNumber}} after completing the today's available moves
common.__column_wip_reached: tried to break WIP-limits in the column Â«{{destinationColumn}}Â» by moving card #{{cardNumber}}
common.__move_card: tried to move the card #{{cardNumber}} from the Â«{{sourceColumn}}Â» to the Â«{{destinationColumn}}Â»

Sponsorship.__description_1: We are pleased to develop Featureban online and do not plan to charge a fee for using the game.
Sponsorship.__description_2: If you want to support the project and give us faith that we are doing the right thing - please donate any amount.

KaitenPromo.__title: Looking for an online kanban software?
KaitenPromo.__description_1: Kaiten is online visualization software for companies and teams who are using Kanban method or agile approaches (Scrum, LeSS, etc.)

playerTooltip.__red_first_rule: one of player's unblocked cards one column right
